metadata.title: CVE-2015-2613 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 7u80 and 8u45, and Java SEEmbedded 7u75 and 8u33 allows remote attackers to affect confidentialityvia vectors related to JCE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2613` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
openjdk-7-source - 7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-demo - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-jre - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
openjdk-6-source - 6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u79-2.5.6-0ubuntu1.14.04.1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b36-1.13.8-0ubuntu1~14.04').
